{{Multiple issues|update = November 2011}} [[File:Galaxy Nexus smartphone.jpg|thumb|[[Galaxy Nexus]], the latest "[[Google Nexus|Google phone]]"]] '''[[Android (operating system)|Android]]''' is a [[solution stack|software stack]] for '''[[mobile devices]]''' that includes an [[operating system]], [[middleware]] and key [[application software|applications]].{{cite web |url=http://code.google.com/android/ |title=Google Projects for Android |year=2011 |work=code.google.com |publisher=Google Inc |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5wiw1JXa2 |archivedate=2011-02-23 |accessdate=2011-02-23}} This page seeks to list and compare hardware devices that are shipped with either Google's Android operating system or its [[OPhone]] derivative from [[China Mobile]]. Google has announced that in Q3 2011, the total number of Android activations had surpassed 190 million, a significant increase from 135 million in Q2 2011. The increase was boosted by sales of lower Android smartphone prices from Chinese and Indian manufacturers.{{cite web |url=http://www.theindonesiatoday.com/retail/android-devices-attained-32-of-smartphone-market-share |title=Android Devices Attained 32 percent of Smartphone Market Share |date=November 14, 2011}} ==Officially released== The following are lists of devices that have been released with Google's Android operating system installed. Multiple names for the same device are entered in the same row where applicable. ===Smartphones=== For an explanation of the columns, see [[Template:Infobox mobile phone/doc]] and/or [[Template:Infobox information appliance/doc]]. ====Acer==== This category contains a list of Android mobile phones released by [[Acer Inc.]] {| style="width:80%; font-size:85%; text-align: center;" class="wikitable sortable" |- !
